page.title: 01Employment.
page.content: Our block is in a very rural area of West Wales.There is very little industry,and the majority of the inhabitants are conected with agriculture. The block contains the village of Bancyfelin and the hamlet of Llangynog. The A40 trunk road runs east to west through the block,while the river Cywin runs north,south. Most of the land is used for dairy or mixed farming,the majority of the farms being small and family run. Eventhough the main London,Fishguard railway running east,west cuts the block in half there is no station and it is a very quiet,peaceful area. Many of the farms and houses are isolated and the great majority of families have their own transport,many families having two or three vehicles.
